title: Printers
text: Bixolon Bluetooth printer for EH tablets Connect to the printer by adding a device in Bluetooth setup. Pin = 0000 Once installed the bixolon printer will appear in the printers and devices. Check the settings of this Bixolon printer and ascertain the COM port number assigned. If the Bixolon printer already exists, it may not connect or pair to it. You may need to delete all the associated printer in devices and printers and start again. The drivers should already be installed but if not should be in the Bixolon folder on the tablet. Create a printer manually in printers (WINRECEIPT) and choose com port the assigned to the Bixolon printer. If windows will not allow you to use WINRECEIPT as it already exists, delete it in regedit (see below). Delete printer from registry. Open Regit and navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Print\Printers Delete the printer from the registry. Open services.msc and restart the Print Spooler service. Citizen CLP-521 Erroring Or Not Printing One Ticket When You Are Expecting Only One Ticket 08 April 2023 15:06 If you are having issues with a Citizen CLP-521 (or CLS-521) follow the below instructions to make sure the printer is set to reflective mode (black mark sensing). Make sure the printer beeps twice at the last stage to make sure it is printing correctly. Once you are happy this has been done, you should be able to press FEED and try sending a ticket to it. If you are still having issues with the printer, make sure the sensor is in the correct position to pick up the black mark on the tickets that are printing. This black mark should be facing down.
description:
Bixolon Bluetooth printer for EH tablets

 

Connect to the printer by adding a device in Bluetooth setup.

Pin = 0000

Once installed the bixolon printer will appear in the printers and devices.

Check the settings of this Bixolon printer and ascertain the COM port number assigned.

If the Bixolon printer already exists, it may not connect or pair to it.

You may need to delete all the associated printer in devices and printers and start again.

The drivers should already be installed but if not should be in the Bixolon folder on the tablet.

 

 

Create a printer manually in printers (WINRECEIPT) and choose com port the assigned to the Bixolon printer.

    If windows will not allow you to use WINRECEIPT as it already exists, delete it in regedit (see below).

 

Delete printer from registry.

Open Regit and navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Print\Printers

Delete the printer from the registry.

Open services.msc and restart the Print Spooler service.



Citizen CLP-521 Erroring Or Not Printing One Ticket When You Are Expecting Only One Ticket

08 April 2023

15:06

If you are having issues with a Citizen CLP-521 (or CLS-521) follow the below instructions to make sure the printer is set to reflective mode (black mark sensing).

 

Make sure the printer beeps twice at the last stage to make sure it is printing correctly. Once you are happy this has been done, you should be able to press FEED and try sending a ticket to it.

 

 

If you are still having issues with the printer, make sure the sensor is in the correct position to pick up the black mark on the tickets that are printing. This black mark should be facing down.

title: Stock Take using PDA Handheld
text: Stock Take using PDA Handheld Stock Take Upload Process following scanning items to handheld: On The PC/Laptop From Merac Back Office. Click on Stock Take/Receipt Icon. Zeroise Stock by Supplier and/or Location you plan to count Stock against. (best to zeroise All Stock Locations to prevent future inaccurate Stock Valuation Report figures) On any Back Office PC/Laptop Click on the Stock Take/Receipt Icon. Ensure that ‘Honeywell PDA’ is set as the Data Source and choose the appropriate StockTake/Movement type from the drop-down box to the left. Click on the drop-down box marked ‘File name’ to the right-hand-side and then select the StockTake record that matches the date/time you uploaded your data (i.e. probably the latest one). Click Upload Selected Transmitted Data button. The data will populate in the grid below. Delete any rows you do not want to upload and click ‘OK’ to update the Stock records. Un-Tick the ‘Add to stock figures where a previous stock take exists within the last 30 days’ check box. Click OK Check a couple of items have the correct stock figures using the Stock Maintenance/Movements screen for a given Stock item. On the Honeywell PDA scanner, go to Data Tasks (OK). Select ‘Delete Collected Data from handheld’. Finished Stock Take using the Handheld PDA: Summary:- Date/Time (UPDATE) Refresh Stock Codes (gets new Stock Code updates from server) Select StockTake from the main panel and then set the ‘To Location’ and ‘From Location’ Scan items Upload Collected Data from Handheld Steps:- (using an Optimus barcode scanner) Before carrying out a Stock Take, prepare the device by connecting the barcode scanner to your Back Office PC and click Send Data button to upload the current Stock Data Stock Codes to the Optimus scanner. Disconnect the scanner and start scanning items, reconnect the Optimus to your Back Office PC and select the ‘Stock Adjustment Type’ and ‘From Location’, ‘Supplier’ and ‘To Location’ if appropriate. Click on ‘Upload Collected Data from Optimus’. The data will populate the grid below. Delete and rows you do not want to upload and click OK to update the Stock records. (using Honeywell PDA handheld barcode scanner) Before performing a Stock Take, ensure that the date/time is correct and the device has the latest Stock Codes. On the PDA handheld when initially powering it on, update Time and Date by selecting ‘Update’. The date/time update will successfully complete provided the device has a WiFi connection to the network. OR If the device is not connected by WiFi, attach the PDA handheld to a Merac Back Office computer via USB cable and using Windows Mobile Active Sync (for Windows XP) or Windows Mobile Device Center (for Windows 7), update Date and Time by selecting ‘Update’. On the PDA handheld, the Merac Stock Control app should open automatically. Select DataTasks/StockControl: select ‘Update’ again and then ‘Proceed’. Enter PIN (known by customer as their Till Login PIN number). On the PDA handheld, select DataTasks/StockControl (OK). Select ‘Refresh Stock Codes’ which does the following - connects to the Merac database and pulls down all up-to-date Stock barcodes then over-writes the handheld scanner’s local Mobiledat.txt file with up-to-date Stock Codes. Wait for the device to update. Once updated, click Close. If the device has carried out a Stock Take before in the past, select ‘Delete Collected Data from Handheld’. Then select ‘Stock Take’ option from the main menu within the Merac Stock Control app and begin scanning stock items once you have specified the ‘Stock Adjustment Type’ (e.g. StockTake), ‘From Location’, ‘Supplier’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Receipt From Supplier’) and ‘To Location’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Move Stock’). Movement Types: Scan each Item, ensuring you type in the Quantity after each scan and press ENTER on Keypad. Continue until all stock is counted. Select Data Tasks/Stock Control (OK). EXIT If not connected to WiFi, connect the Honeywell PDA Handheld PDA to your Back Office PC. On the Honeywell PDA handheld, go into Data Tasks: ‘Upload Collected Data to Server’ and select ‘OK’. This will copy the counted Stock information to Merac Back Office from the handheld connected to the PC. Connecting the Handheld PDA device to your Merac server for the purpose of carrying out a Stock Take requires that the Mobileini.txt text file stored on the PDA device located within the My Device folder needs to contain the following similar lines of information. Obviously the server IP Address needs to match that of the SQL server IP Address… Note! Make sure that there is no or character following ‘SERVER=’. Each PDA Handheld StockTake device used for Stock Take at a site requires a unique DEVICEID. The newer version of the Handheld software only contains one single line for the Server and Database path. For the older version of the Stock Control software, once all scanned Stock has been uploaded to the server from handheld, the MobileUpd.txt file remains on the device and the contents can be cleared for the next Stock Take using DataTasks>>‘Delete Collected Data from Handheld’. For the newer version of the Stock Control software, once all scanned Stock has been uploaded to the server from handheld and before a new Stock Take begins, choose DataTasks>>‘Delete Collected Data from Handheld’, the MobileUpd.txt file is renamed to a format of i.e. MobileUPDArch20160105124922.txt and then archived into a folder on the device. The program will warn the user if the Mobile.UPD has not yet been uploaded but the end-user will be given a choice whether they would like to delete the file anyways. The ‘Delete Collected Data from Handheld’ procedure searches for all MobileUPD archive files present i.e. those beginning with MobileUPDArch… and offers the user the choice to delete them but they may choose not to. PDA Handheld Scanner Stock Control Process Summary Install Microsoft ActiveSync Center (for Windows XP) or Windows Mobile Device Center (for Windows Vista and higher) Connect the device to the PC via USB and using the mobile device connection software above, browse the device using File Explorer. Delete Mobile.upd file (original StockTake file storing counted Stock from previous Stock Take) if it exists!! Delete Mobile.dat file (contains previous scanned Stock from previous Stock Take) Modify Mobile.ini -Change the IP Address to reflect the Merac SQL server IP Address (e.g.192.168.80.201,1433) -Specify the database name to connect to. -The Device Number must be unique (only if more than one Honeywell StockTake scanner will be carrying out the StockTake). The , can be found by remoting onto the SQL Server and using SQL Server Configuration Manager… Also navigate to and there should be the following files inside: 1)Merac.txt - make sure the SERVERPATH is set to ,1433 provided they connect via a specific port else just insert the IP Address. 2)MeracMobileWelcome 3)MstoreMobile (OLD version) 4)MstoreStockTake (NEW version) If files 2), 3) and 4) are corrupt, download the same files from \\svrcompany\ftproot\support\mobile from the Mobile folder and overwrite the existing copies on the device. Power on the device. The Merac Stock Control application will automatically run and present you with a screen to choose DataTasks. This will only occur if you create a shortcut to Mstoremobile.exe (OLD version) else if you are using MstoreStockTake.exe (NEW version), you will be presented with a Merac Mobile app at startup – from there you can choose ‘Stock Control’ from the option menu. Place either one of these files, depending on which one you are using, as a shortcut in My Device>>Windows>>Startup Within DataTasks are the following menu items… Stock Control Refresh Stock Codes Stock Take Upload Collected Data to Server Delete Collected Data from Handheld Select DataTasks >> Stock Control >> Update and then press ‘OK’ once the Date/Time has been successfully updated. Select DataTasks >> Refresh Stock Codes and then press ‘Close’ once done Wait for the device to update and then select Close Select DataTasks >> Stock Take Select Stock Take option from the main menu and then you can begin scanning stock items once you have specified the ‘Stock Adjustment Type’ (e.g. StockTake), ‘From Location’, ‘Supplier’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Receipt From Supplier’) and ‘To Location’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Move Stock’). Once complete… Select DataTasks >> Upload Collected Data to Server Now open Stock Control again and then select ‘Exit’ (the above step is important as this may cause a lock on the Meracupd.txt file used for storing previous Stock Take data scanned and stored by the device!) Select Data Tasks >> Delete Collected Data from Handheld Note! It is important that if you have any outstanding stock takes on the device, that you upload and process it in the normal way before registering any new movements, otherwise you will lose your counted data! Connect handheld to PC or network again using WiFi (if not already connected) and then select the option to “Load Collected Data From Handheld” Open Back Office and then select Setup option>>Stock>>Stock Receipt/Take icon… 1 = Change to Honeywell PDA from drop-down 2 = Select the Stock Take Data File recently uploaded from PDA handheld to Back Office 3 = Select the checkbox “Add to stock figures where a previous stock take exists with the last x days” 4 = Click Upload Selected transmitted data button to provide you with a preview of the items in the file in the lower preview pane before committing the changes to the database server 5 = Check that the data within the preview pane contains your recently scanned items and that the data is accurate (Stock Scanned and Quantity etc.) 6 = Once you are happy with the figures, click OK and then the contents of the file will be uploaded and changes committed to the Merac database All done! Summary of actions to perform on Handheld:- Power on the device. The Merac Mobile application will automatically run and present you with a screen containing the following options: Table Ordering – Stock Control – MACS Scanner. When pressing Stock Control, you have the following options: Refresh Stock Codes Stock Take Upload Collected Data to Server Delete Collected Data from Handheld 1)Select DataTasks >> Stock Control >> Update and then press ‘OK’ once the Date/Time has been successfully updated 2)Select DataTasks >> Refresh Stock Codes and then press ‘Close’ once done 3)Select DataTasks >> Delete Collected Data from Handheld (only required if a Stock Take had previously occurred on the device!) 3)Select DataTasks >> Stock Take and then scan and count your Stock. Once complete… 4)Select DataTasks >> Upload Collected Data to Server 5)Now open Stock Control again and then select ‘Exit’ (the above step is important as this may cause a lock on the Meracupd.txt file used for storing previous Stock Take data collected scanned by the device!) 6)Select Data Tasks >> Delete Collected Data from Handheld Complete! Re-instating the Merac Mobile App software on Handheld at Startup Problem: Table_Ordering/Stock_Take/MembershipCard_Scanning handheld device not loading Merac Mobile App at Startup Make sure all the Merac program files are located in either one of three directory paths - HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\Merac\ OR HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\MStoreStockTake\ OR HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\MStoreMobile\ Merac.CAB **MstoreMobile.exe (OLD version) **MstoreStockTake.exe (NEW version – don’t really need this one!) **MeracMobileWelcome.exe MACScanner.exe MTable.exe **MERAC.TXT (this file gets created the first time you run 'MeracMobileWelcome.exe' to configure the device) Mobileini.txt, MobileDat.txt and MobileUpd.txt are stored in the root directory when browsing the device ('My Device') from File Explorer On the Handheld, press the Microsoft Windows four-checked flag icon to access the Desktop or main Control Panel on the device. Select File Explorer. My Device>>Program Files>>Merac Browse to HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\Merac\ and press and hold select MstoreMobile.exe (OLD version) or MstoreStockTake.exe (NEW version) and choose the option to Copy from context menu. My Device>>Windows>>Start Menu>>Programs Navigate to above location where Desktop shortcuts are stored above and paste the file as a shortcut by selecting this option from the context menu… Copy the shortcut that now appears on the main Control Panel (Desktop) and paste the shortcut into My Device>>Windows>>Startup Restart the handheld and the Merac program should load as expected and present the user with the following menu options… Done! Have asked Gregor to plug handheld into a Windows XP machine because the handheld cannot connect using Active Sync or Windows Mobile Device Centre using Intel x64bit. The device has been successfully connected to the wifi. ************************ PENDING ************************ Need to browse device to check that Merac App files are on the device. The Merac program files are located in either one of three locations below: HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\Merac\ OR HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\MStoreStockTake\ OR HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\MStoreMobile\ Merac.CAB **MstoreMobile.exe (OLD version) **MstoreStockTake.exe (NEW version – don’t really need this one!) **MeracMobileWelcome.exe MACScanner.exe MTable.exe **MERAC.TXT (this file gets created the first time you run 'MeracMobileWelcome.exe' to configure the device) Mobileini.txt, MobileDat.txt and MobileUpd.txt are stored in the root directory when browsing the device ('My Device') from File Explorer ...and also verify that Mobileini.txt file is setup correctly to connect to the server: [NEW Mobileini.txt connection string info.] SERVERPATH=192.168.0.10, Note! The newer version of the Handheld software only contains one single line for the Server and Database path. [OLD Mobileini.txt connection string info.] SERVER=192.168.0.10, DATABASE=MStore DEVICEID= Note! Make sure that there is no or character following ‘SERVER=’. Each PDA Handheld StockTake device used for Stock Take at a site requires a unique DEVICEID. Steps: ******* 1) On the PDA handheld when initially powering it on, update Time and Date by selecting ‘Update’. The date/time update will successfully complete provided the device has a WiFi connection to the network. 2) DataTasks/StockControl: select ‘Update’ again and then ‘Proceed’. Enter PIN (known by customer as their Till Login PIN number). 3) Select ‘Refresh Stock Codes’ which does the following - connects to the Merac database and pulls down all up-to-date Stock barcodes and stores them in a file called Mobile.dat. Wait for the device to update. Once updated, click Close. 4) If the device has carried out a Stock Take before in the past, select ‘Delete Collected Data from Handheld’, else skip to step 5). 5) Then select ‘Stock Take’ option from the main menu within the Merac Stock Control app and begin scanning stock items once you have specified the ‘Stock Adjustment Type’ (e.g. StockTake), ‘From Location’, ‘Supplier’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Receipt From Supplier’) and ‘To Location’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Move Stock’). 6) Scan each Item, ensuring you type in the Quantity after each scan and press ENTER on Keypad. Continue until all stock is counted. 7) When done, select Data Tasks>>Stock Control (OK). 8)Select 'Upload Collected Data from Handheld' which will upload the MobileUpd.txt file contaiing recently scanned Stock to the server and will be present as a file from the Merac Back Office 'StockReceipt/Take' utility window once Data Source 'Honeywell PDA' is selected from the 'File name' drop-down box. 8) Select EXIT from the Stock Control app. Done!
description:
Stock Take using PDA Handheld

 

 

Stock Take Upload Process following scanning items to handheld: 

On The PC/Laptop

  • From Merac Back Office. Click on Stock Take/Receipt Icon.
  • Zeroise Stock by Supplier and/or Location you plan to count Stock against.

(best to zeroise All Stock Locations to prevent future inaccurate Stock Valuation Report figures)

 

On any Back Office PC/Laptop

  • Click on the Stock Take/Receipt Icon.
  • Ensure that ‘Honeywell PDA’ is set as the Data Source and choose the appropriate StockTake/Movement type from the drop-down box to the left. 
  • Click on the drop-down box marked ‘File name’ to the right-hand-side and then select the StockTake record that matches the date/time you uploaded your data (i.e. probably the latest one).
  • Click Upload Selected Transmitted Data button. The data will populate in the grid below. Delete any rows you do not want to upload and click ‘OK’ to update the Stock records.
  • Un-Tick the ‘Add to stock figures where a previous stock take exists within the last 30 days’ check box.
  • Click OK 
  • Check a couple of items have the correct stock figures using the Stock Maintenance/Movements screen for a given Stock item.
  • On the Honeywell PDA scanner, go to Data Tasks (OK).
  • Select ‘Delete Collected Data from handheld’.
  • Finished

 

 

Stock Take using the Handheld PDA:

 

Summary:-

  • Date/Time (UPDATE)
  • Refresh Stock Codes (gets new Stock Code updates from server)
  • Select StockTake from the main panel and then set the ‘To Location’ and ‘From Location’
  • Scan items
  • Upload Collected Data from Handheld

 

Steps:-

(using an Optimus barcode scanner)

  • Before carrying out a Stock Take, prepare the device by connecting the barcode scanner to your Back Office PC and click Send Data button to upload the current Stock Data Stock Codes to the Optimus scanner.
  • Disconnect the scanner and start scanning items, reconnect the Optimus to your Back Office PC and select the ‘Stock Adjustment Type’ and ‘From Location’, ‘Supplier’ and ‘To Location’ if appropriate.
  • Click on ‘Upload Collected Data from Optimus’. The data will populate the grid below.
  • Delete and rows you do not want to upload and click OK to update the Stock records.

(using Honeywell PDA handheld barcode scanner)

Before performing a Stock Take, ensure that the date/time is correct and the device has the latest Stock Codes. On the PDA handheld when initially powering it on, update Time and Date by selecting ‘Update’. The date/time update will successfully complete provided the device has a WiFi connection to the network.

OR

If the device is not connected by WiFi, attach the PDA handheld to a Merac Back Office computer via USB cable and using Windows Mobile Active Sync (for Windows XP) or Windows Mobile Device Center (for Windows 7), update Date and Time by selecting ‘Update’.

 

  • On the PDA handheld, the Merac Stock Control app should open automatically. Select DataTasks/StockControl: select ‘Update’ again and then ‘Proceed’. Enter PIN (known by customer as their Till Login PIN number).
  • On the PDA handheld, select DataTasks/StockControl (OK).
  • Select ‘Refresh Stock Codes’ which does the following - connects to the Merac database and pulls down all up-to-date Stock barcodes then over-writes the handheld scanner’s local Mobiledat.txt file with up-to-date Stock Codes.
  • Wait for the device to update. Once updated, click Close. 
  • If the device has carried out a Stock Take before in the past, select ‘Delete Collected Data from Handheld’.
  • Then select ‘Stock Take’ option from the main menu within the Merac Stock Control app and begin scanning stock items once you have specified the ‘Stock Adjustment Type’ (e.g. StockTake), ‘From Location’, ‘Supplier’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Receipt From Supplier’) and ‘To Location’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Move Stock’).

 

Movement Types:

 

 

  • Scan each Item, ensuring you type in the Quantity after each scan and press ENTER on Keypad.
  • Continue until all stock is counted.
  • Select Data Tasks/Stock Control (OK).
  • EXIT
  • If not connected to WiFi, connect the Honeywell PDA Handheld PDA to your Back Office PC. 
  • On the Honeywell PDA handheld, go into Data Tasks: ‘Upload Collected Data to Server’ and select ‘OK’. This will copy the counted Stock information to Merac Back Office from the handheld connected to the PC.

 

Connecting the Handheld PDA device to your Merac server for the purpose of carrying out a Stock Take requires that the

Mobileini.txt text file stored on the PDA device located within the My Device folder needs to contain the following similar lines of information. Obviously the server IP Address needs to match that of the SQL server IP Address…

 

 

Note!

Make sure that there is no <ENTER> or <LineFeed> character following ‘SERVER=’.

Each PDA Handheld StockTake device used for Stock Take at a site requires a unique DEVICEID.

 

The newer version of the Handheld software only contains one single line for the Server and Database path.

  • For the older version of the Stock Control software, once all scanned Stock has been uploaded to the server from handheld, the MobileUpd.txt file remains on the device and the contents can be cleared for the next Stock Take using DataTasks>>‘Delete Collected Data from Handheld’.
  • For the newer version of the Stock Control software, once all scanned Stock has been uploaded to the server from handheld and before a new Stock Take begins, choose DataTasks>>‘Delete Collected Data from Handheld’, the MobileUpd.txt file is renamed to a format of <MobileUPDArchdatetime.txt> i.e. MobileUPDArch20160105124922.txt and then archived into a folder on the device.

The program will warn the user if the Mobile.UPD has not yet been uploaded but the end-user will be given a choice whether they would like to delete the file anyways. The ‘Delete Collected Data from Handheld’ procedure searches for all MobileUPD archive files present i.e. those beginning with MobileUPDArch… and offers the user the choice to delete them but they may choose not to.

 

PDA Handheld Scanner Stock Control Process Summary

Install Microsoft ActiveSync Center (for Windows XP) or Windows Mobile Device Center (for Windows Vista and higher)

Connect the device to the PC via USB and using the mobile device connection software above, browse the device using File Explorer.

Delete Mobile.upd file (original StockTake file storing counted Stock from previous Stock Take) if it exists!!

Delete Mobile.dat file (contains previous scanned Stock from previous Stock Take)

Modify Mobile.ini 

            -Change the IP Address to reflect the Merac SQL server IP Address (e.g.192.168.80.201,1433)

 

   

            -Specify the database name to connect to.

-The Device Number must be unique (only if more than one Honeywell StockTake scanner will be carrying out the StockTake). 

 

The <IP_Address>,<Port_Number> can be found by remoting onto the SQL Server and using SQL Server Configuration Manager…

 

 

 

Also navigate to <Device File Explorer:\Program Files\Merac> and there should be the following files inside:

1)Merac.txt - make sure the SERVERPATH is set to <ServerIPAddress>,1433 provided they connect via a specific port else just insert the IP Address.

2)MeracMobileWelcome

3)MstoreMobile (OLD version)

4)MstoreStockTake (NEW version)

 

 

If files 2), 3) and 4) are corrupt, download the same files from \\svrcompany\ftproot\support\mobile from the Mobile folder and overwrite the existing copies on the device.

Power on the device. The Merac Stock Control application will automatically run and present you with a screen to choose DataTasks. This will only occur if you create a shortcut to Mstoremobile.exe (OLD version) else if you are using MstoreStockTake.exe (NEW version), you will be presented with a Merac Mobile app at startup – from there you can choose ‘Stock Control’ from the option menu. Place either one of these files, depending on which one you are using, as a shortcut in 

My Device>>Windows>>Startup

 

Within DataTasks are the following menu items…

  • Stock Control
  • Refresh Stock Codes
  • Stock Take
  • Upload Collected Data to Server
  • Delete Collected Data from Handheld

 

Select DataTasks >> Stock Control >> Update and then press ‘OK’ once the Date/Time has been successfully updated.

Select DataTasks >> Refresh Stock Codes and then press ‘Close’ once done

Wait for the device to update and then select Close

Select DataTasks >> Stock Take

Select Stock Take option from the main menu and then you can begin scanning stock items once you have specified the ‘Stock Adjustment Type’ (e.g. StockTake), ‘From Location’, ‘Supplier’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Receipt From Supplier’) and ‘To Location’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Move Stock’). Once complete…

Select DataTasks >> Upload Collected Data to Server

Now open Stock Control again and then select ‘Exit’

(the above step is important as this may cause a lock on the Meracupd.txt file used for storing previous Stock Take data scanned and stored by the device!)

Select Data Tasks >> Delete Collected Data from Handheld

 

Note!

It is important that if you have any outstanding stock takes on the device, that you upload and process it in the normal way before registering any new movements, otherwise you will lose your counted data!

 

Connect handheld to PC or network again using WiFi (if not already connected) and then select the option to “Load Collected Data From Handheld”

Open Back Office and then select Setup option>>Stock>>Stock Receipt/Take icon…

 

 

1 = Change to Honeywell PDA from drop-down

2 = Select the Stock Take Data File recently uploaded from PDA handheld to Back Office

3 = Select the checkbox “Add to stock figures where a previous stock take exists with the last x days”

4 = Click Upload Selected transmitted data button to provide you with a preview of the items in the file in the lower preview pane before committing the changes to the database server

5 = Check that the data within the preview pane contains your recently scanned items and that the data is accurate (Stock Scanned and Quantity etc.)

6 = Once you are happy with the figures, click OK and then the contents of the file will be uploaded and changes committed to the Merac database

All done!

 

Summary of actions to perform on Handheld:-

Power on the device. The Merac Mobile application will automatically run and present you with a screen containing the following options: Table Ordering – Stock Control – MACS Scanner.

 

 

When pressing Stock Control, you have the following options:

  • Refresh Stock Codes
  • Stock Take
  • Upload Collected Data to Server
  • Delete Collected Data from Handheld

1)Select DataTasks >> Stock Control >> Update and then press ‘OK’ once the Date/Time has been successfully updated

2)Select DataTasks >> Refresh Stock Codes and then press ‘Close’ once done

3)Select DataTasks >> Delete Collected Data from Handheld (only required if a Stock Take had previously occurred on the device!) 

3)Select DataTasks >> Stock Take and then scan and count your Stock. Once complete…

4)Select DataTasks >> Upload Collected Data to Server

5)Now open Stock Control again and then select ‘Exit’

(the above step is important as this may cause a lock on the Meracupd.txt file used for storing previous Stock Take data collected scanned by the device!)

6)Select Data Tasks >> Delete Collected Data from Handheld

Complete!

 

Re-instating the Merac Mobile App software on Handheld at Startup

Problem: 

Table_Ordering/Stock_Take/MembershipCard_Scanning handheld device not loading Merac Mobile App at Startup

 

  1. Make sure all the Merac program files are located in either one of three directory paths -

HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\Merac\

OR

HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\MStoreStockTake\

OR

HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\MStoreMobile\

 

Merac.CAB

**MstoreMobile.exe (OLD version)

**MstoreStockTake.exe (NEW version – don’t really need this one!)

**MeracMobileWelcome.exe

MACScanner.exe

MTable.exe

**MERAC.TXT (this file gets created the first time you run 'MeracMobileWelcome.exe' to configure the device)

                

Mobileini.txt, MobileDat.txt and MobileUpd.txt are stored in the root directory when browsing the device ('My Device') from File Explorer

 

  1. On the Handheld, press the Microsoft Windows four-checked flag icon to access the Desktop or main Control Panel on the device. Select File Explorer.

My Device>>Program Files>>Merac

Browse to HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\Merac\ and press and hold select MstoreMobile.exe (OLD version) or MstoreStockTake.exe (NEW version) and choose the option to Copy from context menu.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

                My Device>>Windows>>Start Menu>>Programs

Navigate to above location where Desktop shortcuts are stored above and paste the file as a shortcut by selecting this option from the context menu…

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Copy the shortcut that now appears on the main Control Panel (Desktop) and paste the shortcut into My Device>>Windows>>Startup

 

Restart the handheld and the Merac program should load as expected and present the user with the following menu options…

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Done!

 

 

 

Have asked Gregor to plug handheld into a Windows XP machine because the handheld cannot connect using Active Sync or Windows Mobile Device Centre using Intel x64bit. The device has been successfully connected to the wifi.

 

************************

PENDING

************************

Need to browse device to check that Merac App files are on the device. The Merac program files are located in either one of three locations below:

 

HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\Merac\

OR

HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\MStoreStockTake\

OR

HandheldDevice:Computer\ID13190D8284\\\Program Files\MStoreMobile\

 

Merac.CAB

**MstoreMobile.exe (OLD version)

**MstoreStockTake.exe (NEW version – don’t really need this one!)

**MeracMobileWelcome.exe

MACScanner.exe

MTable.exe

**MERAC.TXT (this file gets created the first time you run 'MeracMobileWelcome.exe' to configure the device)

                

Mobileini.txt, MobileDat.txt and MobileUpd.txt are stored in the root directory when browsing the device ('My Device') from File Explorer

 

...and also verify that Mobileini.txt file is setup correctly to connect to the server:

[NEW Mobileini.txt connection string info.]

SERVERPATH=192.168.0.10,<NoPortNum>

 

Note!

The newer version of the Handheld software only contains one single line for the Server and Database path.

 

[OLD Mobileini.txt connection string info.]

SERVER=192.168.0.10,<NoPortNum>

DATABASE=MStore

DEVICEID=<UniqueIDNumber>

 

Note!

Make sure that there is no <ENTER> or <LineFeed> character following ‘SERVER=’.

Each PDA Handheld StockTake device used for Stock Take at a site requires a unique DEVICEID.

 

Steps:

*******

1) On the PDA handheld when initially powering it on, update Time and Date by selecting ‘Update’. The date/time update will successfully complete provided the device has a WiFi connection to the network.

 

2) DataTasks/StockControl: select ‘Update’ again and then ‘Proceed’. Enter PIN (known by customer as their Till Login PIN number).

 

3) Select ‘Refresh Stock Codes’ which does the following - connects to the Merac database and pulls down all up-to-date Stock barcodes and stores them in a file called Mobile.dat. Wait for the device to update. Once updated, click Close. 

 

4) If the device has carried out a Stock Take before in the past, select ‘Delete Collected Data from Handheld’, else skip to step 5).

 

5) Then select ‘Stock Take’ option from the main menu within the Merac Stock Control app and begin scanning stock items once you have specified the ‘Stock Adjustment Type’ (e.g. StockTake), ‘From Location’, ‘Supplier’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Receipt From Supplier’) and ‘To Location’ (if Adjustment Type selected is ‘Move Stock’).

 

6) Scan each Item, ensuring you type in the Quantity after each scan and press ENTER on Keypad. Continue until all stock is counted.

 

7) When done, select Data Tasks>>Stock Control (OK).

 

8)Select 'Upload Collected Data from Handheld' which will upload the MobileUpd.txt file contaiing recently scanned Stock to the server and will be present as a file from the Merac Back Office 'StockReceipt/Take' utility window once Data Source 'Honeywell PDA' is selected from the 'File name' drop-down box. 

 

8) Select EXIT from the Stock Control app.

 

Done!

title: Stock Taking (Simple)   CONNECT Wifi to network first
text: On The PC/Laptop Into stock Take/Receipt Icon Zeroise Stock by The Supplier and or Location you plan to count On The Scanner Update Into Data Tasks: update again Proceed Login (with your till pin number) Data Tasks (OK) Refresh Stock Codes Wait to Update Close Stock Take Source: Main Stock Location Scan the Item, type Qty and press enter on Key Pad Continue until all stock is counted EXIT Data tasks (OK) Upload Collected Data to Server On The PC/Laptop Into stock Take/Receipt Icon Drop List To Honeywell PDA Select You stock take on the right hand drop down box Upload Selected Transmitted Data Un-Tick the Add to stock figures over last 30 days etc box Upload and Complete Stock Take OK Ok to update all these stock figures OK Adjustment Successfully Made Stock Index Check a couple of items have the correct stock figures On The Scanner Data Tasks (OK) Delete Collected Data From the handheld Finished
description:
On The PC/Laptop

    • Into stock Take/Receipt Icon
    • Zeroise Stock by The Supplier and or Location you plan to count

 

On The Scanner

    • Update
    • Into Data Tasks: update again
    • Proceed
    • Login (with your till pin number)
    • Data Tasks (OK)
    • Refresh Stock Codes 
    • Wait to Update
    • Close
    • Stock Take
    • Source: Main Stock Location
    • Scan the Item,  type Qty and press enter on Key Pad
    • Continue until all stock is counted
    • EXIT
    • Data tasks (OK)
    • Upload Collected Data to Server

 

On The PC/Laptop

    • Into stock Take/Receipt Icon
    • Drop List To Honeywell PDA
    • Select You stock take on the right hand drop down box
    • Upload Selected Transmitted Data
    • Un-Tick the Add to stock figures over last 30 days etc box
    • Upload and Complete Stock Take
    • OK
    • Ok to update all these stock figures 
    • OK
    • Adjustment Successfully Made
    • Stock Index
    • Check a couple of items have the correct stock figures

 

On The Scanner

    • Data Tasks (OK)
    • Delete Collected Data From the handheld
    • Finished

title: Configure Prefixes & Suffixes For Integrated Barcode Scanners
text: 1. Run EZConfig-Scanning v4_v4.5.9_Setup.exe as administrator. 2. Give everyone full permission over the folder C:\Program Files (x86)\Honeywell. 3. Run shortcut 'EZConfig-Scanning v4_Chrome' on desktop as admin in Google Chrome. Alternatively, create shortcut of C:\Program Files (x86)\Honeywell\EZConfig-Scanning v4\EZCSHomePageUI.HTML and run that shortcut as admin. 4. 'Allow blocked content' that appears at the bottom of the Internet browser window. 5. Click 'Connected Devices'. 6. The next steps are are highly temperamental so requires patience as majority of the time the device will either not be picked up or says 'Failed to connect with device'. Close and open the program after several attempts. Restart PC and go back to step 3 if necessary. 7. Once scanner is found, take note of the model. E.g. N5600. Click 'Configure device'. 8. Click 'Open config'. Locate the 'ConfigSettings[-XXXXX].EXM' depending on the model of the scanner. Select and open it, then click 'Save to device'. 9. Close the window and this will now work. If message says 'Failed to save to device', disregard and test on till.
description:
1. Run EZConfig-Scanning v4_v4.5.9_Setup.exe as administrator.

2. Give everyone full permission over the folder C:\Program Files (x86)\Honeywell.

3. Run shortcut 'EZConfig-Scanning v4_Chrome' on desktop as admin in Google Chrome. Alternatively, create shortcut of C:\Program Files (x86)\Honeywell\EZConfig-Scanning v4\EZCSHomePageUI.HTML and run that shortcut as admin.

4. 'Allow blocked content' that appears at the bottom of the Internet browser window.

5. Click 'Connected Devices'.

6. The next steps are are highly temperamental so requires patience as majority of the time the device will either not be picked up or says 'Failed to connect with device'. Close and open the program after several attempts. Restart PC and go back to step 3 if necessary.

7. Once scanner is found, take note of the model. E.g. N5600. Click 'Configure device'.

8. Click 'Open config'. Locate the 'ConfigSettings[-XXXXX].EXM' depending on the model of the scanner. Select and open it, then click 'Save to device'.

9. Close the window and this will now work. If message says 'Failed to save to device', disregard and test on till.

title: Information When Updating Stock Take Devices Server Details
text: When updating stock take server details, like the device identifier, make sure you remove/archive existing data files for the stock take software before refreshing stock codes and creating new ones, as these files do not automatically update, and therefore will state the original identifier when uploading files to the database.
description: When updating stock take server details, like the device identifier, make sure you remove/archive existing data files for the stock take software before refreshing stock codes and creating new ones, as these files do not automatically update, and therefore will state the original identifier when uploading files to the database.

title: Display setting customer screen new POS model 2024
text: Set the display setting for the customer screen to 1360 x 768, and sat usecustomerscreen = 4
description: Set the display setting for the customer screen to 1360 x 768, and sat usecustomerscreen = 4

title: Label printer on new POS hardware (Setup Germany)
text: The new POS hardware has only two COM ports. In the German setup, both COM ports are used for the receipt printer and card terminal. To print labels from the new POS hardware, you will need to use a COM-to-USB adapter. As soon as you plug in the USB, the PC will add a COM port. That COM port number needs to be added to the setup in: C:\POS\Program\bin\Debug\Printer\Configuration under ESC Koder.
description:
The new POS hardware has only two COM ports. In the German setup, both COM ports are used for the receipt printer and card terminal. To print labels from the new POS hardware, you will need to use a COM-to-USB adapter.



As soon as you plug in the USB, the PC will add a COM port. 

 

That COM port number needs to be added to the setup in:

C:\POS\Program\bin\Debug\Printer\Configuration

under ESC Koder.
